title.narrative: Conference : Rethinking African Economic Policy in Light of the Global Financial Crisis
Conférence sur l'examen des politiques économiques africaines à la lumière de la crise financière mondiale

description.narrative: The global financial crisis and the prospect of slow recovery do not bode well for countries that were just catching up to growthrates in the rest of the developing world. At their meeting in Tunis, 12 November 2008, African finance ministers and central bank governors agreed to establish an advisory committee to monitor developments, provide follow-up, and make proposals on how best to contribute to international deliberations on the economic impact of the financial crisis and mitigating measures. A common question facing all countries is whether the economic policies adopted over the past 10 years should be reconsidered in light of the global financial crisis. The United States and Europe have responded by increasing government participation in the financial and real sector. Should African countries now rethink their privatization and fiscal austerity measures? To address these issues, the African Economic Research Consortium (AERC) is organizing a conference on the theme, Rethinking African Economic Policy in Light of the Global Financial Crisis, in Nairobi, 6-8 December 2009. The meeting will be held in the context of the Joint Policy Workshop (African Union Commission, African Development Bank-AfDB, Joint Africa Institute-JAI, World Bank, United Nations Economic Commission for Africa-UNECA, United Nations Development Programme/Regional Bureau for Africa-UNDP/RBA and AERC) and back-to-back with the AERC biannual research workshop. This grant will help cover the cost of the conference.
